item.description:
Hey everyone, it's summer and the dates for different activities are getting nailed down! So, the plan is to do three rock climbing weekends again this year. Similar format as to last years. See plan below, in either case you have a choice of lessons with a guide, or organizing your own climb nearby.

August 30th.

How it will work:

1. Show up FRIDAY night, get your bunk, meet the people you'll be tied up with on Saturday
2. SATURDAY morning continental b'fast around 7am. Grab your Wedeln lunch.
a. at this point if you're not taking a lesson you are free to roam about.
b. if you are taking a lesson go onto step 3.
3. Go to EMS and get gear and assigned a guide.
a. we will do our best to make sure the ratio is 3 to 1 climbers to guides
b. we will sort people out by skill level - Newbie, climbed in doors, more advanced (may want to learn how to place rope etc)
4. Go climb!!! (small backpack, water, snacks, packed Wedeln lunch as you'll probably eat on the side of the mountain)
5. Return home triumphant to a Wedeln group meal
6. Saturday evening, hang out around bonfire before retiring to bed
7. SUNDAY wake up for continental b'fast at 8am. At this point in time you are on your own for the day. Hike, bike, shop, or go do more rock climbing!


Pricing:

Guide - $135
Food - $45 (includes 2 bfast, packed lunch, fluid, snacks, steaktip dinner, bonfire, and drinks - let me know if vegetarian or if there are any dietary restrictions).
Guest fee lodging - $40 (non-eiscl members pay this)

Non-Members Save $20 by booking the whole package
Total is $199!

EICSL Members Save $60 by booking the package
Total is $160


We accept Visa & MasterCard
Payment must be made by August 18th for the August 30th weekend!

If you are interested in attending this event payment must be made ASAP! Contact me direct!

Matt
Matt@MLBSki.Com
978-234-0120
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at Wedeln House Friday Night
item.why: Learn to Rock climb with friends on real rock outdoors in New England and enjoy the summer!
item.name: Rock Climbing weekend - 8/30 White Mountains of NH
